snippet: The story of Lia Lee, the severely brain-damaged daughter of Hmong refugees, inspired a book that affected the way American medicine is practiced across cultures.
abstract: Lia Lee, severely brain-damaged daughter of Hmong refugees who had resettled in California, died in Sacamento on Aug 31 after spending the last 26 of her 30 years in a persistent vegetative state; Lia, who suffered heavily from seizures, was the subject of Ann Fadiman's 1997 book The Spirit Catches You and You Fall Down.
lead_paragraph: The story of Lia Lee, the severely brain-damaged daughter of Hmong refugees, inspired a book that affected the way American medicine is practiced across cultures.
